dialogue.text: have you ever wanted a perfect face well now you can have one with the all new perfect face boy face sold separately
now whenever you walk into a room all everyone will think about is how perfect your face is and they will ignore the rest of you it’s just like what you want isn’t that awesome i think it is
anyway do you remember that time you got rug-burn from wrestling on the rug i don’t think you do but i do that was a really fun day i guess it wasn’t really wrestling though
if you and i were perfect face boy what do you think we’d see when we look at each other
i want to remember all those other things we said and thought and did
i still want perfect hair forever
I tap on Nodoka’s name in my phone and think about blowing my brains out.
Rain King.
When do you think we’ll be able to go home today?
Not until the well runs dry.
You know what they say about leaving before we’re supposed to.
Do I?
I hope so. That’s the only reason we know each other.
I can remember {i}that{/i} at least. But I still don’t get why we always have to close our eyes.
What do you think they do while we can’t see each other?
I can always see you. Even when I close my eyes.
Really?
There’s a computer monitor in my childhood home. It never turns off.
She insists on keeping her eyes glued to it in a way that only someone with alogia could. You’d feel terrible to see her.
I bet she’s beautiful, though — if she has anything to do with you.
I’ve seen pieces of her scalp come off with the brush before. It’s such a sad thing. She can barely even eat, that old dame.
Is it still growing?
It shrinks. Day by day. Her hair is turning gray. Yet all I can do is pray I don’t end up that way.
I’ve been thinking about buying Perfect Face Boy.
For who?
For me.
Why?
You don’t have to do that.
My mom said it might make me better.
You’re already as good as you can be.
It isn’t enough.
It’s enough for me.
Say...
If I ever break, will you be the one to look after me?
Me?
I can think of no one better to comb the scalp out of my hair.
Of course, Nodoka.
Anything for my little sister.
I tap on my left hand instead of my phone and it activates phonebeep.wav anyway because nothing is real.
Sensei! Hi! What are you doing here?
Hi, outdated Chika sprite. I'm trying to contact Nodoka.
How did we even get inside of the mall? Isn’t it supposed to be closed for renovations?
Not that I know of. But I’m Chika from the {i}past.{/i} You know! Like, {i}before{/i} you took advantage of my desire for love and stability and let me think we were a couple for years.
How does Chika from the past have knowledge of the present?
{b}{size=+15}STOP ASKING STUPID QUESTIONS!{/b}{/size}
Anyway, if you came here for Perfect Face Boy, we’re all sold out. Some girl with a flower in her hair just bought the last one. Something about “market research” I think?
Damn. I’m going to have to figure out a different birthday present for Nodoka, then.
Who’s this Nodoka girl you keep talking about? Is she from Ms. Matsubara’s class?
Who?
Oh. Sorry. Who’s this Nodoka girl you keep talking about? Is she from Ms. Watabe’s class?
No, she’s from that other school that hasn’t sunken into the ground yet. She’s a bit of an enigma, but I think her heart is in the right place most of the time.
Where is it the rest of the time?
Probably Ami’s underwear drawer. Where would {i}you{/i} hide human remains, Chika?
Hahah! Wouldn’t {i}you{/i} like to know?
Anyway! I’ve gotta run, Sensei. My break is almost over.
But if you ever feel like luring someone into a false sense of romantic security before entirely shattering their world view by fucking all of their friends, feel free to drop by again!
Thanks, Chika. I think I will. Good luck with Perfect Face Boy.
Thanks, Sensei! Good luck with contacting that Nodoka girl!
I manage to leave the mall through a meat-filled crack in the wall before returning home for a quick change of clothes and starting over.
I tap on Nodoka’s name in my phone and wait for her to answer.
{i}Ahem.{/i}
I would like to sleep like a cat.
What? Like, now? Did I wake you up?
With all the fur of time...and a tongue rough as flint.
Uh...
With the dry sex of fire...and after speaking to no one, stretch myself over the world. Over roofs and landscapes...with a passionate desire to hunt the rats in my dreams.
Well, I’m glad to hear you’re doing fine.
And I’m surprised to hear you didn’t recognize that poem, Akira. Not a fan of Chilean diplomats?
Yeah, can’t say that’s a major area of expertise for me. What are you up to right now? Besides being weird, I mean.
A bit of this...a bit of that. All in an effort to make the world a better place, of course.
Well, how about putting that on hold and coming over to my place for a little while?
Oh?
So long as you promise not to coax me into a state of unconsciousness via sex again.
Aww...But I took such good care of you while you were out.
That doesn’t change the fact that it was {i}kind of{/i} weird and creepy.
Then, how about I make it up to you by letting you bed {i}me{/i} the next time I slip into a state of unconsciousness?
Or we could just have normal, conscious sex together. That works too.
Does it?
Does...Does that just not do it for you? Or...
It just sounds to me that this is a...{i}recreational{/i} booty call, rather than the type I’ve grown accustomed to from you.
Are you coming or not? I can also come to you if-
I’ll be there shortly, Akira. I’ve already hailed a cab.
Now, please describe in vivid detail the things you plan on doing to me as I place you on speaker from the backseat of this car.
I hope you’re ready to study, because that’s all we’re going to be doing today.
Heh...
I’ll see you soon.
Nodoka arrives about ten minutes later, prompting me to question why more people don’t just take taxis after I invite them over.
That question is quickly answered when I remember the type of crowd I typically invite over and how they likely don’t have much pocket money.
Now, {i}relatively famous authors,{/i} on the other hand...
I have to say...I’m quite intrigued by whatever is going on here, Akira. I didn’t believe I was on the list of girls you were willing to see {i}casually.{/i}
You’re going to be even more surprised when you find out I called you over to ask for your hand in marriage.
Ahh, I see. And in lieu of a ring, I presume you’re going to offer up your body instead?
Would you rather the ring?
You can give that to Otoha instead. She can add it to the collection. Your warm embrace is all {i}I{/i} care for, Akira.
Then-
But {i}first,{/i} I have a...surprise for you.
What...kind of surprise? You didn’t bring a bag. And I don’t see any-
Perhaps it’s something I have on beneath my clothes? Perhaps it’s an...{i}act of service?{/i} Perhaps both. Perhaps neither.
The allure is in not knowing. Don’t you want to find out?
Unless you want to just have {i}boring{/i} old, consensual missionary sex.
I actually think that would be really hot with you.
I suppose it would, wouldn’t it? It’d be very uncharacteristic without one of us forcing the other into a state of delirium.
Yeah. But I don’t get to experience “surprises” very often, so I’ll go along with it this time.
Just so you’re aware, though, we {i}will{/i} be having consensual missionary sex the next time you come over. Whether you like it or not.
{i}Ahh, yes. Spoken just like a man who doesn’t know the meaning of the word “consent.” This is why I keep you so close to my heart, Akira.{/i}
Wait, why do you sound so far away all of a sudden?
{i}Hm? You’ll have to speak up. I can’t hear you from your daughter’s room.{/i}
What?
{i}Wow. It’s quite...feminine in here, isn’t it?{/i}
Nodoka — I’d really prefer it if you {i}don’t{/i} go exploring inside of Ami’s room. Especially if you’re going to lock me out of it.
{i}Why is that, Akira? There’s not something you’re trying to hide from me in here, is there?{/i}
What? No. It’s just weird and Ami has been particularly creepy lately. I wouldn’t want her coming home and-
{i}Hurting me? A cute little thing like her? Do you think she could manage it?{/i}
I’m thinking a lot of things right now. And almost all of them have to do with the fact that you came over and immediately tricked me into closing my eyes so you could invade Ami’s privacy.
But I’m doing this for {i}you.{/i} This is the surprise I was talking about. You just need to let me prepare first.
{i}Prepare what? Because that implies some level of intent and I highly doubt you’ve been plotting this out for longer than five minutes total.{/i}
And why would you think that?
{i}Because if you’d been plotting it any longer, you’d have accomplished it already.{/i}
Heh. You give me too much credit.
Sometimes, I really {i}am{/i} just a curious little girl.
{i}And who is better at showing “curious little girls” the...ins and outs of life than their daddy?{/i}
I’m beginning to think this isn’t for {i}me{/i} at all.
{i}It’s for both of us, Akira. But only one of us is willing to openly admit it.{/i}
Nodoka-
{i}Just be patient. I’ll unlock the door in a moment.{/i}
{i}But when I do...please don’t assault me immediately.{/i}
{i}It may take me a moment or two to...get fully in character.{/i}
I keep my ear pressed against the door, listening to Nodoka rummage through Ami’s closet and drawers and...anything else she can get her hands on, I imagine.
And while my initial instinct is to break the door down, I’m a bit reluctant to do that as it would be much harder to explain away than just...some of Ami’s belongings being shifted around.

If she wants to play games, that’s fine. She can mess with {i}me{/i} all she wants. But dragging my {i}daughter{/i} into her nonsense just to satisfy her curiosity isn’t...something I can let happen anymore.

I promised to really protect Ami when I decided to take up the title of “father.” And knowing Nodoka’s history, it’s...hard for me to imagine she doesn’t have some sort of ulterior motive to what she’s doing right now.
{i}Okay...that should do it.{/i}
{i}You may enter, Akira. But again, please do not assault me as soon as you-{/i}
Welcome home, Dad! I’ve been waiting for you all day!
And now that you’re here, it means we get to cuddle and watch movies and cuddle and eat ice cream and cuddle and-
What...
The fuck...
Do you think you’re doing?...
Cosplay! Aren’t I adorable, {i}Dad?{/i}
Take her clothes off. Now.
You want to touch your little girl that badly? Was it hard being away from me all day?
How about we get in the bath together and I wash your back?! And anything else that needs washing! Maybe your penis? With my mouth? That sounds fun, right?
Why?...
Because I love you, of course!
No, Nodoka. Why are you doing this?
Because I love you, of course!
Did that make your heart skip a beat?
Is it because I look like her? Because I sound like her? Or am I still obviously {i}me?{/i}
You’re...better at impersonating her than you should be. But she isn’t exactly hard to mimic. Like, even the hair is-
Spot-on, right?
And to think {i}I{/i} barely even have any acting experience. Can you imagine how effective this ruse would be if I had {i}practice?{/i}
Sure. But I still don’t get {i}why.{/i} And just pretending you love me doesn’t answer it.
Maybe I’m just a super big Ami fan?! Her style...her eyes...her poetry...those cute little A-cups you can’t help but wanna grab and squeeze and make her blush and cum and wet herself!
That wholesome, incestuous desire to be bred by her father because her love is so pure and uninfluenced by the many evils of this universe...
Isn’t Ami just the greatest?...
{i}Isn’t she?{/i}
Are you acting again?
Of course not, Dad. This is just who I want to {i}be.{/i} So I’m making my bestest effort to be the perfect daughter for you. That way, you’ll never need anyone else and can stay with me always.
Are you making fun of her right now?
Does it {i}sound{/i} like I’m making fun of her? Is any of what I said untrue? Were some of the words {i}not{/i} words Ami would use?
Nodoka-
Those are all serious questions, by the way. I really want to know.
Then ask {i}her.{/i} You don’t have to sneak into her room and put on her clothes if you want to learn more about her. Just talk to her.
Assuming any of that is actually true and this isn’t just some sexual fantasy of yours where you can satisfy the need to fuck the father you no longer have.
What makes you think I ever had a father at all and wasn’t just made in a tube?
Sometimes, not much.
Would you still fuck me if I really {i}was{/i} your daughter?
Nodoka-
Do you fuck Ami even though she’s {i}not?{/i} Is it even true that she’s {i}not?{/i} What’s it like? How does she taste? How different am I? How can I be more like her?
Is this really for my sake, Nodoka?
Call me Ami.
Absolutely not.
Then how about Nodokami? It combines both of our names {i}and{/i} makes me feel like a god. Everyone wins.
Everyone except the actual Ami, who just had her closet raided by a psychopath who wants to pretend she’s fucking her dad.
My intentions aren’t {i}always{/i} evil genius levels of malicious, Akira. I figured you’d know that about me by now.
You figured I’d be happy to have an Ami who isn’t {i}actually{/i} Ami?
Yes. Because, the way I see it, if you {i}aren’t{/i} already fucking her, this would give you the chance to do it guilt-free.
And if you {i}are,{/i} this could be a fun new flavor of fake incest you can compare and contrast with the real thing.
But you’re getting something out of it. You wouldn’t do this if you didn’t have something to gain.
Sometimes, I just want to understand things.
And I have a hard time doing that if the things I {i}want{/i} to understand don’t make any sense.
Nodo-
I had a dream last night...
That we were closer than we thought.
But there was a dark cloud looming over us. And it wouldn’t let us be what we {i}needed{/i} to be in order to be happy.
That cloud was jealous. But it was jealous because it wanted the same thing.
It had been waiting to rain for centuries, but was too afraid to open itself up because it was worried it might flood the world and drown {i}you.{/i} Beautiful you.

Everyone else could be washed away for all it cared. And despite my wanting to lock you inside and protect you...I couldn’t help but feel the need to give you up when I compared myself to that darkness.
But you won’t ever {i}be{/i} that darkness, Nodoka.
No...I suppose I won’t.
But I can still aspire to understand it. And if I spend long enough inside its mindset, maybe I’ll be able to feel what {i}it{/i} feels.
There is something special about Ami. And I don’t want to wait for the rain anymore. I want to feel it. I want to feel {i}her.{/i} I want to feel the way {i}she{/i} feels {i}you.{/i}
It’s but one of many missing pieces in many of my unsolved puzzles...
All on the way to perfect hair forever.
